FALLOUT SHELTERS
§ 151.130 CONSTRUCTION STANDARDS.
   (A)   All fallout shelters shall comply with the minimum construction
standards established by the Emergency Services and Disaster Administration in
the following publications:
      (1)   MP-15 The Family Fallout Shelter, June, 1959 (reprinted November,
1960); and
      (2)   NP-10-2 National Plan Appendix Series Fallout Shelter Surveys Guide
for Architects and Engineers, May, 1960 (reprinted July, 1960).
   (B)   In addition, minimum construction standards shall be the same as set
forth in the International Building Code adopted in §
151.001.
(2000 Code, § 15.48.010)
§ 151.131 PERMIT FEES.
   The city waives any building permit fee that it may be entitled to collect
under this chapter when application is made to construct a fallout shelter
under this chapter.
(2000 Code, § 15.48.020)
MULTIPLE-OWNER COMPLEXES
§ 151.145 PREAMBLES.
   The preambles recited in this ordinance codified in this chapter are
expressly incorporated within and made a part of this chapter.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.010) (Ord. 2380, Art. 1, passed - - 1999)
§ 151.146 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply
unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning.
   COMMON ELEMENTS. All portions of the multi-ownership, multiple-unit
development property except the individual living units.
   CONDOMINIUM. Any property submitted or included as part of a development
registered under the Condominium Property Act, ILCS Ch. 765, Act 605, §§ 1 et
seq.
   CONVERSION. Any property which has changed ownership from a multi-family
dwelling structure to individual condominium units.
   CONVERSION/DWELLING UNIT. Any individual condominium unit created by the
conversion of a multi-family dwelling structure to individual condominium
units.
   COOPERATIVE. Any multi-unit real estate development operated by means of a
voluntary association, corporation, land trust or otherwise.
   DEVELOPMENT. Any property consisting of three or more parts intended for any
type of independent use whether contained in one or more multiple structures.
It shall include, but not be limited to, any association, condominium
development, cooperative, planned unit development or other entity which
includes as part of the development the maintenance and joint ownership of
common elements.
   OWNERSHIP INTEREST. Any legal title where an estate or interest individually
or collectively aggregates a fee simple absolute ownership of the unit.
OWNERSHIP INTEREST shall include shareholders, holders of beneficial interest
in land trusts, as well as holders of other common ownership interests.
Ownership shall not include any individual or entity whose interest is as
mortgagee or holder of a security interest.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.030) (Ord. 2380, Art. 3, passed - -1999; Ord. 2603, § 1,
passed - -2002)
§ 151.147 MULTIPLE OWNERSHIP/MULTIPLE UNIT INSPECTION REVIEW BOARD.
   (A)   There is established an Inspection Review Board.
   (B)   The Board shall consist of three members, who shall be the City
Administrator or his or her designee, the Superintendent of Public Works and
the Fire Chief.
   (C)   No official business shall be transacted by the Board unless a quorum
of members is present. The Board is empowered to enact its rules of procedures.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.020) (Ord. 2380, Art. 2, passed - -1999)
§ 151.148 REGISTRATION/CONVERSION OF STRUCTURES CONSTRUCTED PRIOR TO 1996.
   All multi-family rental dwelling structures intended to be converted to
condominium units shall be registered with the Building Department.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.035) (Ord. 2603, § 2, passed - -2002)
§ 151.149 MULTIPLE OWNERSHIP/MULTIPLE UNIT DEVELOPMENT REGISTRATION
REQUIREMENTS.
   (A)   No multiple-ownership/multiple unit development shall be in compliance
with city ordinances unless the development holds and maintains a current,
unrevoked certificate of registration issued by the city in its name for the
specifically named development.
   (B)   Every certificate of registration shall be issued for a period of one
year from its date of issuance unless sooner revoked, and may be renewed for
successive annual periods.
   (C)   (1)   No certificate of registration shall be issued or renewed unless
the completed application form is accompanied by payment of an annual
registration fee. The annual registration fee for an operating license for
multi-family dwellings shall be $5 per dwelling unit.
      (2)   The annual registration shall be due by May 31. If not paid by May
31 of each year, a late charge of $5 per unit shall be imposed.
      (3)   In the event that all registration and any late fees are not fully
paid by the end of June 30, the Building Commissioner shall suspend the
certificate(s) of occupancy until all payments are fully made.
      (4)   This provision shall become effective for the registration year
2000.
   (D)   The Building Commissioner is authorized to investigate and to issue
new certificates of registration upon application therefor or renewal therefor,
in the name of the development. No certificate shall be issued unless the
development for which the certificate is sought is found, after inspection by
the Building Commissioner or his or designee, to meet all requirements of these
codified ordinances and of applicable rules and regulations promulgated
pursuant thereto. Each applicant shall be notified by the Building Commissioner
in advance of the date and time of the inspection.
   (E)   The Building Commissioner is authorized to inspect the common elements
of the development. Nothing is intended to nor grants the power to the Building
Commissioner to inspect any individual living unit.
   (F)   No certificate of registration shall be issued or renewed unless the
completed application is accompanied by payment of an annual registration fee.
The annual registration fee for an operating license for a development shall be
$5 per dwelling unit.
   (G)   No certificate of registration shall be issued or renewed for an
application unless the applicant has first designated an agent for the receipt
of service of complaints for violations of any of the provisions of these
codified ordinances and for service of process pursuant thereto. The
designation shall be made in writing and shall accompany each application form.
   (H)   An application for renewal of a certificate of registration shall be
made 30 days prior to the expiration of the present certificate.
   (I)   Each certificate shall be displayed in a conspicuous place within the
common ways of the development. Every person holding a certificate shall give
notice in writing to the Building Commissioner within five days after having
transferred or otherwise disposed of the legal control of any development. The
notice shall include the name and address of the person succeeding to the
control of the development.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.040) (Ord. 2380, Art. 4, passed - -1999; Ord. 2411, § 2,
passed - -1999; Ord. 2414, § 2, passed - -1999; Ord. 2423, § 2, passed - -1999;
Ord. 2603, § 3, passed - -2002)
§ 151.150 DWELLING UNIT REGISTRATION REQUIREMENTS.
   (A)   No dwelling conversion unit in a converted structure built prior to
1996 shall be in compliance unless the unit holds and maintains a current
unrevoked certificate of registration issued by the city in the name of the
current owner.
   (B)   Every certificate of registration shall be issued for a period of one
year from its date of issuance unless sooner revoked, and may be renewed for
successive annual periods.
   (C)   No certificate of registration shall be issued or renewed unless the
completed application form is accompanied by payment of an annual registration
fee. The annual registration fee shall be $5.
   (D)   The Building Commissioner is authorized to investigate and to issue
new certificates of registration upon application therefor or renewal therefor,
in the name of the owner. No certificate shall be issued unless the dwelling
unit for which the certificate is sought is found, after inspection by the
Building Commissioner or his or her designee, to meet all requirements of these
codified ordinances and of applicable rules and regulations promulgated
pursuant thereto. Each applicant shall be notified by the Building Commissioner
in advance of the date and time of the inspection.
   (E)   An application for renewal of a certificate of registration shall be
made 30 days prior to the expiration of the present certificate.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.045) (Ord. 2603, § 4, passed - -2002)
§ 151.151 ADDITIONAL INSPECTIONS.
   (A)   The Building Commissioner is authorized to inspect the common elements
of any development to determine whether the development remains in full
compliance with city ordinances.
   (B)   If upon inspection the Building Commissioner determines the
development is not in full compliance with city ordinances, the Building
Commissioner may proceed with the suspension or revocation of the certificate
of registration as outlined in §
151.152.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.050) (Ord. 2380, Art. 5, passed - -1999)
§ 151.152 SUSPENSION OR REVOCATION OF CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION.
   (A)   Whenever, upon inspection of a development or conversion/dwelling unit
for initial registration or renewal of a certificate of registration, the
Building Commissioner finds that conditions or practices exist which are in
violation of this subchapter, or of any applicable provision of these codified
ordinances or an applicable rule or regulation promulgated pursuant thereto,
the Building Commissioner shall serve the designated agent or owner of the
dwelling unit with notice of the violation. The notice shall state that unless
the violation cited is corrected within not less than five days, except for
emergency situations, the certificate of registration may be suspended.
   (B)   At the end of the time, the Building Commissioner has allowed for
correction of any violation cited, the Building Commissioner or his or her duly
authorized designee shall reinspect the development or conversion/dwelling unit
and, if he or she determines that the violation has not been corrected, he or
she may issue an order suspending the certificate. The order shall take effect
five days following service upon the designated agent or owner of the dwelling
unit unless, in the interim, the development or unit owner requests, in
writing, a hearing.
   (C)   Any person whose certificate of registration is subject to suspension
pursuant to a suspension order shall be entitled to a hearing on the suspension
action by filing with the City Clerk a written receipt for a hearing before the
Building Inspection Review Board within two business days following the receipt
of the suspension order. Upon receipt of the request, a hearing shall be
scheduled to be held before the Board not more ten business days thereafter.
Upon completion of the hearing, the Board may either:
      (1)   Confirm the suspension;
      (2)   Suspend the suspension and allow additional compliance time; or
      (3)   Rescind the suspension.
   (D)   If no petition for reconsideration of a suspension order is filed as
provided herein, the suspension order shall remain in effect until the
violation in question has been corrected, as determined by the Building
Commissioner upon inspection of the development or conversion/dwelling unit.
   (E)   If a certificate of registration is suspended, and the suspension is
affirmed after hearing, if any, during the period of suspension the following
apply:
      (1)   The city may seek enforcement of any applicable law; and
      (2)   The city may seek the imposition of penalties as provided by this
code.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.060) (Ord. 2380, Art. 6, passed - -1999; Ord. 2603, § 5
(part), passed - -2002)
§ 151.153 FAILURE TO REGISTER.
   In the event of a failure by any development or conversion/dwelling unit to
register as required under this chapter, each individual or entity which
possesses an ownership interest in the development or conversion/dwelling unit
shall be responsible for the responsibilities and penalties as outlined in this
subchapter.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.070) (Ord. 2380, Art. 7, passed - -1999; Ord. 2603, § 5
(part), passed - -2002)
§ 151.154 GUARANTEES.
   The city does not guarantee the condition of any property which is the
subject matter of this subchapter, and the city is not responsible for any
claim arising out of the subject property or the conditions thereof. The city
does not warrant that all deficiencies are listed in a certificate of housing
inspection and does not warrant anything as to the condition of the property or
the habitability thereof.
(2000 Code, § 15.64.080) (Ord. 2380, Art. 8, passed - -1999)
RENTAL MULTI-FAMILY DWELLING STRUCTURES
§ 151.165 DEFINITIONS.
   For the purpose of this subchapter, the following definitions shall apply
unless the context clearly indicates or requires a different meaning.
   BUILDING INSPECTION REVIEW BOARD. The review panel consisting of the
Community Development Director or his or her designee, the Police Chief and the
Fire Chief.
   CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION. The certificate issued to a landlord or owner
by the Community Development Director that demonstrates that the landlord’s or
owner’s multi-family dwelling structure complies with the standards set forth
in this subchapter.
   CITY CODES. All applicable city building construction, maintenance, life
safety and zoning codes, ordinances, rules and regulations including, without
limitation, all applicable codes adopted and established in this Title XV.
   COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT DIRECTOR. The currently appointed Community
Development Director and his or her designee.
   DWELLING UNIT. An individual dwelling unit in a multi-family dwelling
structure arranged, designed and used as a rental residence or living quarters
by one or more persons.
   LANDLORD. The person who is in charge of the day to day management of a
multi-family dwelling structure and may include the owner.
   LESSEE. The person and any person claiming under that person, such as sub-
lessees, who enters into a rental contract for a dwelling unit within a multi-
family dwelling structure.
   MULTI-FAMILY DWELLING STRUCTURE. A building containing three or more
dwelling units.
   OWNER. The person, people or entity who are the legal title holders of a
multi-family dwelling structure or a dwelling unit.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.166 FEES, PENALTIES AND OTHER CHARGES.
   Unless otherwise provided, all references to fees, penalties and other
charges in this subchapter are those established from time to time by the city
and a schedule of all current fees, penalties and other charges, including
copies, is on file with the Community Development Department at all times.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008) Penalty, see §
151.999
§ 151.167 CERTIFICATE OF HOUSING INSPECTION PREREQUISITE TO OPERATION, LEASE OR
SALE; TERM.
   (A)   No multi-family dwelling structure shall be operated as rental housing
unless the owner or landlord of the structure applies for and obtains a current
and enforceable certificate of registration issued by the Community Development
Director. The certificate of registration will be issued in the name of the
owner and landlord for the specifically identified multi-family dwelling
structure.
   (B)   No owner or landlord of a multi-family dwelling structure will
contract for the sale of the structure, or lease a dwelling unit, without
having first provided the buyer or lessee with a current and enforceable
certificate of registration for the property made within one month prior to the
date of the conveyance of the structure or lease of a dwelling unit.
   (C)   Every certificate of registration shall be issued for a period of one
year from its date of issuance unless sooner revoked, and may be renewed for
successive one-year periods.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.168 APPLICATION PROCEDURES FOR CERTIFICATES OF REGISTRATION.
   (A)   All applications for a certificate of housing inspection shall be made
on forms prescribed by the Community Development Director. The Community
Development Director will issue a certificate of registration within 14
business days after an inspection of the multi-family dwelling structure.
   (B)   The owner’s or landlord’s consent to the inspection will be given by
the owner’s or landlord’s filing of an application for a certificate of
registration together with the applicable inspection fee. The Community
Development Department will inspect the multi-family dwelling structure for
compliance with all applicable city codes.
   (C)   In the event that the Community Development Director finds any
violations of any city codes, he or she will provide the landlord or owner with
an itemized list of the violations. No certificate will be issued unless and
until all violations have been corrected to the satisfaction of the Community
Development Director. In the event a reinspection is necessary to inspect any
cited violations, the landlord or owner will be responsible for and pay a
reinspection fee. Payment of the reinspection fee will be due prior to the
reinspection. No person who is the owner or landlord of a multi-family dwelling
structure will permit the occupancy of any dwelling unit in the structure until
all violations have been remedied and the structure has been brought into
compliance with all city codes.
   (D)   All multi-family dwelling structure owners and landlords must apply
for an initial application for registration within 30 days after the effective
date of this subchapter.
   (E)   (1)   An application for renewal of a certificate of registration
shall be made not less than 45 days prior to the expiration of the present
certificate of registration. No application for a certificate of registration
will be processed unless the application is accompanied by payment of an annual
registration fee. Failure to file a completed application by December 15 of the
year preceding the renewal year may result in a delay of processing the
application and issuance of a certificate of registration beyond January 1 of
the renewal year. In the event that an application is filed beyond December 15
of the year preceding the renewal year, the applicant may request in writing
that the Community Development Director issue a provisional certificate of
registration pending inspection. Any request for a provisional certificate of
registration will be granted by the Community Development Director in his or
her discretion based upon the following factors:
         (a)   History of code, ordinance, rule or regulation enforcement
actions taken against the owner or landlord or the subject multi-family
dwelling structure;
         (b)   History of applicant in filing timely renewal applications; and
         (c)   Any currently known city code, ordinance, rule or regulation
violations, including any outside the scope of this subchapter.
      (2)   Any application completed on or after January 1 of the renewal year
shall be assessed a late fee.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.169 CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION.
   (A)   No certificate of registration will be issued or renewed for an
applicant unless and until the applicant has first designated an agent for the
receipt of service of complaints for violations of any city code and for
service of process when the applicant is absent from the city for 30 or more
days. The designation must be made in writing and accompany each application
form.
   (B)   A current and enforceable certificate of registration must be
displayed in a conspicuous place within the common areas of the multi-family
dwelling structure at all times. Every owner or landlord holding a certificate
of registration must give notice in writing to the Community Development
Director within ten days of closing on a transaction that conveys legal title,
in whole or in part, to another party. The notice must include the name and
address of the person succeeding to the ownership or control of the multi-
family dwelling structure.
   (C)   Certificates of registration in no way warrant or guarantee the
condition of the multi-family dwelling structure or any individual dwelling
unit and the city will have no responsibility for any claim arising out of the
multi-family dwelling structure or the condition thereof. Each certificate of
registration will have the following statement printed on its face:
      The holder of this certificate of registration acknowledges and agrees
that the city is not and will not be, in any way, liable for any damages or
injuries that may be sustained as a result of the city’s inspection of these
premises and that the city’s inspection and approval of these premises does
not, and will not, in any way, be deemed to insure the holder of this
certificate of registration against any damage or injury of any kind and at any
time.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.170 CONSENT TO INSPECTION; SCOPE OF INSPECTION; LIMITATIONS; WARRANTS.
   (A)   Any application made under this subchapter shall constitute an
acknowledgment and consent on the part of the applicant to authorize the city
to make inspection of the multi-family dwelling structure in accordance with
the requirements of this subchapter. The landlord or owner will provide access
to the multi-family dwelling structure and dwelling units, as appropriate, to
the Community Development Director during reasonable business hours.
Inspections for renewal certificates of registration must be permitted by the
multi-family dwelling structure owner or landlord prior to December 31 of each
preceding year.
   (B)   All inspections made under this subchapter are limited to inspecting
the condition of the multi- family dwelling structure and dwelling units, as
appropriate, to ensure compliance with all city codes.
   (C)   No inspection made under this chapter will be used to prosecute any
other type of city code, ordinance, rule or regulation except as established in
this subchapter, nor will any visual or physical evidence collected during an
inspection made under this subchapter be admissible in or used for any other
city code, ordinance, rule or regulation enforcement action, including any
actions normally undertaken by the Police Department.
   (D)   (1)   Where no consent has been given to enter or inspect a multi-
family dwelling structure or dwelling unit, as appropriate no entry or
inspection will be made without the city first obtaining a warrant from the
circuit court. The court may consider any of the following factors, along with
other matters as it deems pertinent, in its decision as to whether or not to
issue a warrant:
         (a)   An eyewitness account of a violation;
         (b)   Citizens’ complaints;
         (c)   Tenant complaints;
         (d)   Plain view violations;
         (e)   Violations apparent from city records;
         (f)   Property deterioration;
         (g)   The age of the property;
         (h)   The nature of the alleged violation;
         (i)   Similar properties in the area;
         (j)   Documented violations of similar properties in the area;
         (k)   The passage of time since the last inspection; and
         (l)   A previous violation on the property.
      (2)   Cause for issuance of a warrant shall be deemed to exist when,
based on reasonable legislative and administrative standards, there is reason
to believe that a violation of a city code exists with respect to a particular
multi-family dwelling structure.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.171 BUILDING INSPECTION REVIEW BOARD.
   There is established a Building Inspection Review Board. The Building
Inspection Review Board will hear all appeals from any actions taken by the
Community Development Director under this subchapter. The Board will consist of
the Community Development Director, the Police Chief and the Fire Chief. No
official business will be transacted by the Board unless a quorum of members is
present. The Board is empowered to enact its own rules of procedure.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
§ 151.172 BUILDING INSPECTION REVIEW BOARD PROCEDURES; APPEALS.
   (A)   Whenever the Community Development Director finds that conditions or
practices exist which are in violation of this subchapter, the Community
Development Director shall serve the owner or landlord with written notice of
any violation. The notice will state that unless each violation is corrected
within five days, or a longer time as may be determined by the Community
Development Director, except for emergency situations, the certificate of
registration may be suspended.
   (B)   At the end of the time, the Community Development Director has allowed
for correction of any violation cited, the Community Development Director, will
reinspect the multi-family dwelling structure and, if he or she determines that
any violation has not been corrected, he or she may issue an order suspending
the certificate. The order will take effect five days following service upon
the landlord or owner unless, in the interim, the landlord or owner requests,
in writing, a hearing.
   (C)   (1)   Any person whose certificate of registration for a multi-family
dwelling is subject to a suspension order is entitled to a hearing on the
suspension action by filing with the City Clerk a written petition for a
hearing before the Building Inspection Review Board within two business days
following the receipt of the suspension order. Upon receipt of a request, a
hearing will be scheduled not more than ten business days thereafter. Upon
completion of the hearing, the Board may either:
         (a)   Confirm the suspension;
         (b)   Delay the suspension and allow additional compliance time; or
         (c)   Rescind the suspension.
      (2)   All final decisions of the Building Review Board will be made in
writing and specify the reasons for its decision. A copy of the final decision
will be delivered to the owner or landlord and placed on file with the
Community Development Director.
   (D)   If no petition for reconsideration of a suspension order is filed as
provided herein, the suspension order will remain in effect until the violation
in question has been corrected, as determined by the Community Development
Director upon inspection of the multi-family dwelling structure or individual
dwelling unit.
   (E)   If a certificate of registration is suspended, and the suspension is
affirmed after hearing:
      (1)   No existing rental agreement can be renewed and no new rental
agreement can be entered into with respect to any rental unit located within
the structure; and
      (2)   The city may seek enforcement of its order in the circuit court in
law or in equity.
   (F)   Any appeal from a final decision of the Building Review Board will be
heard at a regular meeting of the City Council. All appeals from a decision of
the Building Review Board must be made in writing to the Community Development
Director within 15 business days after a final decision of the Building Review
Board. The Community Development Director will schedule the date of an appeal
hearing in front of the City Council not more than 30 days after the filing of
an appeal. At the appeal hearing, the City Council may:
      (1)   Confirm the suspension;
      (2)   Delay the suspension and allow additional compliance time; or
      (3)   Rescind the suspension.
(Ord. 2008-02-160O, passed 3-25-2008)
SEWER SYSTEM CONNECTION CHARGE
